title: Chapda Chutney
subtitle: Spicy red ant chutney
description: Known as Chapda, this fiery red ant chutney is a traditional delicacy of the Bastar tribes. Made from dried red ants and their eggs, it is rich in formic acid and believed to cure ailments like fever and cough. The sharp, tangy taste combined with local spices makes it unique.

title: Mahua Lata
subtitle: Traditional flower wine
description: Brewed from the fragrant flowers of the Mahua tree, this traditional wine is central to tribal culture. It is consumed during festivals, weddings, and social gatherings as a sacred community drink.

title: Mahua Gathering
subtitle: Forest produce livelihood
description: The collection of Mahua flowers is a seasonal activity involving entire families. Flowers are dried and stored for year-round use in food, liquor, and traditional medicine.

title: Chila
subtitle: Rice flour pancake
description: Chila is a simple pancake made from rice flour and water. It is commonly eaten for breakfast and is often served with chutney or forest vegetables.

title: Bore Basi
subtitle: Fermented rice meal
description: Bore Basi is a traditional dish made by soaking cooked rice overnight in water. It is eaten in the morning, especially during summers, and is known for keeping the body cool and improving digestion.

title: Pej
subtitle: Rice water drink
description: Pej is a light rice water drink prepared during rice cooking. It is nutritious, easy to digest, and commonly consumed by elders and children.

title: Kodo–Kutki Rice
subtitle: Nutritious millet meal
description: Kodo and Kutki are traditional millets grown by tribal communities. They are highly nutritious and used to prepare rice, porridge, and rotis.

title: Sukha Saag
subtitle: Dry forest greens
description: Sukha Saag is made from dried forest leafy vegetables. It is cooked with minimal spices and reflects the tribes’ deep knowledge of edible forest plants.

title: Chila
subtitle: Traditional Rice Pancake
description: Chila is a soft pancake made from rice batter or gram flour. It is commonly eaten as breakfast with chutney.

title: Faraa
subtitle: Steamed Rice Dumplings
description: Faraa is made from rice flour dough stuffed with spiced lentils and steamed. It is a healthy traditional snack.

title: Angakar Roti
subtitle: Thick Rice Bread
description: A thick roti made of rice flour, traditionally cooked over chulha and served with chutney or curry.

title: Bafauri
subtitle: Steamed Chana Snack
description: Bafauri is a steamed snack made from chana dal paste mixed with spices. It is oil-free and healthy.

title: Dubki Kadhi
subtitle: Gram Flour Curry
description: A flavorful kadhi made with gram flour dumplings dipped in tangy yogurt curry.

title: Muthiya
subtitle: Rice Dumpling Dish
description: Muthiya is a steamed rice flour dish shaped by hand and served with spicy chutney.

title: Aamat
subtitle: Tribal Mixed Vegetable Curry
description: Aamat is a traditional Bastar curry made with bamboo shoots and mixed vegetables.

title: Thethri
subtitle: Crunchy Festive Snack
description: A crispy snack prepared during festivals, made with wheat flour and spices.

title: Khurmi
subtitle: Sweet Festive Delight
description: Khurmi is a traditional sweet prepared during weddings and festivals.

title: Dehrori
subtitle: Sweet Rice Dessert
description: A sweet dish made from rice batter and jaggery, deep-fried and soaked in sugar syrup.

title: Bara
subtitle: Lentil Fritter
description: A deep-fried lentil snack commonly served with chutney.

title: Tikhur Kheer
subtitle: Cooling Root Dessert
description: A summer dessert made from tikhur root powder, milk and sugar.

title: Chaprah Chutney
subtitle: Red Ant Chutney
description: A famous Bastar delicacy made from red ants and spices, known for its tangy taste.

title: Mahua Ladoo
subtitle: Traditional Tribal Sweet
description: Sweet balls made from dried Mahua flowers mixed with jaggery.

title: Chousela
subtitle: Festive Fried Bread
description: Deep-fried rice bread served during festivals and weddings.

title: Bhajia
subtitle: Crispy Evening Snack
description: Vegetable fritters fried in gram flour batter, popular as evening snack.

title: Sabudana Khichdi
subtitle: Fasting Special Dish
description: A light dish made from soaked sabudana, peanuts and spices.

title: Tilgur Ladoo
subtitle: Winter Sweet
description: Sweet balls made from sesame seeds and jaggery during winter.

title: Rice Pitha
subtitle: Traditional Steamed Cake
description: A steamed rice cake stuffed with jaggery and coconut.
